messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] Technical question
messages.msgSnippet: I use gmail, and have this same frustration!  I usually reply to the postm and since gmail keeps all the posts together, you can just go up and copy from the
messages.messageBody:
I use gmail, and have this same frustration! I usually reply to the postm
and since gmail keeps all the posts together, you can just go up and copy
from the original and paste it in your reply.

Hope this helps! If anyone has a better way, let me know!

Kim

wrote:

> copy, but I haven't been able to figure out how to do that in gmail. Since
> the discussion on this list get pretty involved, I think its more
> important
> than ever that I learn how to do that.
>
> Anybody out there use gmail, and do you know how to snip?
>
> Thanks,
> Carron

messages.subject: Technical question
messages.msgSnippet: I have an e-mail related question, not an unschooling question per se. When I reply to a previous post, I would like to snip out just the relevant portions.
messages.messageBody:
I have an e-mail related question, not an unschooling question per se.

When I reply to a previous post, I would like to snip out just the relevant
portions. For some reason, gmail is the first e-mail service I've used that
doesn't allow me to do that very easily. At least I can't figure out how
to. I used to be able to just highlight the passage I wanted to keep or
copy, but I haven't been able to figure out how to do that in gmail. Since
the discussion on this list get pretty involved, I think its more important
than ever that I learn how to do that.

Anybody out there use gmail, and do you know how to snip?

Thanks,
Carron


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
